org.as2lib.ant
Class Swfmill

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.tools.ant.ProjectComponent
      org.apache.tools.ant.Task
          org.as2lib.ant.Swfmill

public class Swfmill
extends org.apache.tools.ant.Task

Swfmill is an ant task for swfmill that processes xml so swf and vice versa.

You can include it as task in your build file as follows; note that for this to work this class must be in the classpath, either in the global one or in the one of eclipse's ant plugin.

<taskdef name="swfmill" classname="org.as2lib.ant.SwfMill"/>

You can then use the declared task as any other task. The simplest usage is to create a swf from a xml file (swf2xml command) or vice versa (xml2swf command).

<swfmill src="src.xml" dest="dest.swf"/>

<swfmill src="src.swf" dest="dest.xml"/>

You can also use the 'xslt' command.

<swfmill src="src.xml" dest="dest.swf" xsl="my.xsl"/>

You can also explicitly specify which command to use. This must be done when you want to use the 'simple' command.

<swfmill src="src.xml" dest="dest.swf" cmd="simple"/>

If the swfmill executable is not included as environment variable in your operating system you must either include it or set it yourself for every swfmill-tag using the "swfmill" attribute. Take a look at setSwfmill(String) for more information.

This task can take the following arguments:

  • src or source or in
  • dest or destination or out
  • xsl
  • cmd or command
  • help
  • quiet
  • verbose
  • dump
  • swfmill

Since:
11.06.2005
Author:
Simon Wacker
See Also:
Swfmill Homepage, Apache Ant

Method Detail

addText

public void addText(java.lang.String xml)
Sets the swfmill xml.

You must wrap the xml in a CDATA block: 

<swfmill src="${src.dir}/com/simonwacker/ant/Sample.as" dest="${build.dir}/sample.swf">
  <![CDATA[
    <movie width="300" height="100" framerate="31">
      <background color='#FF8A00'/>
      <frame>
        <library>
          <clip id="simonwacker" import="files/simonwacker.jpg"/>
          <font id="pixel" import="files/pixel.ttf"/>
        </library>
      </frame>
    </movie>
  ]]>
</swf>

Parameters:
xml - the swfmill xml to use

setCmd

public void setCmd(Swfmill.Command command)
Sets the command to use. The command is by default determined depending on the file types of the set source and destination files, but you can also explicitely specify the desired command.

A xml source file results in the usage of the xml2swf command by default and a swf source file in the swf2xml command. If you want to use the simple command you must explicitely specify this.

The xslt command is used if a xsl file is set.

Parameters:
command - the swfmill command to use

setCommand

public void setCommand(Swfmill.Command command)
Sets the command to use. The command is by default determined depending on the file types of the set source and destination files, but you can also explicitely specify the desired command.

A xml source file results in the usage of the xml2swf command by default and a swf source file in the swf2xml command. If you want to use the simple command you must explicitely specify this.

The xslt command is used if a xsl file is set.

Parameters:
command - the swfmill command to use

setSwfmill

public void setSwfmill(java.lang.String swfmill)
Sets the path to or name of the swfmill executable.

The path can either be an absolute path: E:/Programming/Flash/swfmill/swfmill.exe

or a relative path: lib/swfmill/swfmill.exe

You may also just use the name of the executable (without the file extension) if the directory it resides in is included in the 'PATH' environment variable: swfmill

If you do not set a swfmill executable SWFMILL will be used. This requires that you include the directory in which the swfmill executable resides in the 'PATH' environment variable.

Parameters:
swfmill - the path to or name of the swfmill executable

setVerbose

public void setVerbose(boolean verbose)
Sets whether to turn verbose mode on or off. If turned on verbose output is made which may be needed for debugging.

Parameters:
verbose - determines whether to turn verbose mode on or off

setXsl

public void setXsl(java.io.File xsl)
Sets the xsl file if you want to use the xslt command of swfmill.

Parameters:
xsl - the xsl file
